get.description: Returns the profile of the authenticated user. Works with all authentication strategies (Local, JWT, Google OAuth, API Key). Use Authorization: Bearer <api-key> or X-API-Key header.

get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of available tools with comprehensive filtering, sorting and search capabilities.

parameters.description: Page number (1-based)

parameters.name: fields

parameters.name: toolkitSlug

parameters.description: Filter to only show important/featured tools (set to "true" to enable)

parameters.name: tags

parameters.name: includeDeprecated
parameters.description: Include deprecated tools in the response

parameters.name: toolkitVersions

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for pagination. The cursor is a base64 encoded string of the page and limit.

info.title: Flowra API (API Key Endpoints)
info.description:
**Flowra** is an AI-powered platform for building agents, workflows, and integrations.

### Capabilities
- **Tools & Toolkits** – Define and group tools for agents and workflows.
- **Workflows** – Orchestrate steps and automate processes.
- **Triggers** – Schedule or event-based execution.
- **Auth & Connections** – OAuth, API keys, and connected accounts.
- **MCP** – Model Context Protocol server integration.
- **Knowledge / RAG** – Add files and URLs for retrieval-augmented generation.

### Authentication
Use the **x-api-key** header with a project API key to access endpoints that support API Key auth. Create and manage API keys in the dashboard under your project settings.

Only endpoints that support API Key authentication via the @ApiKeyEnabled() decorator.

tags.name: Tools
tags.description: List, execute, and manage tools for agents and workflows

tags.name: Toolkits
tags.description: Group tools into toolkits for reuse

tags.name: auth-config

tags.name: connected-accounts
tags.description: OAuth connected accounts and link creation

x-api-key.name: x-api-key
x-api-key.description: Project API key. Create and manage keys in the dashboard under Project → API Keys. Send as header: x-api-key: <your-key>

name.description: Name for the API Key (for identification)

description.description: Optional description for the API Key

total.description: Total number of items across all pages

hasNextPage.description: Whether there is a next page

hasPreviousPage.description: Whether there is a previous page

name.description: Name for the API Key (for identification)

description.description: Optional description for the API Key

Array of role names to assign to the user

config.description: تنظیمات درگاه (API Key, Secret Key, etc.)

total.description: Total number of items across all pages

hasNextPage.description: Whether there is a next page

hasPreviousPage.description: Whether there is a previous page

parameters.description: Custom authentication parameters

text.description: Natural language description of what to accomplish
text.example: Send a message to the #general channel

noAuth.description: Whether the tool requires no authentication
Whether the tool requires no authentication

name.description: Name (slug): lowercase letters, numbers, hyphens. Unique per project.

mode.description: Mode of the MCP server: NORMAL (specific tools) or SMART (meta tools only)

selectedTools.description: Tool slugs to attach to the MCP server (NORMAL mode). Stored in workspace internally.

isPublic.description: Whether the MCP server is public

config.description: Configuration for the MCP server (endpoint, authToken, etc.)

externalMcpConfigs.description: External MCP configs (name, url, headers?, tools) stored on workspace, same as workflow.

url.description: External MCP server URL (POST endpoint for JSON-RPC tools/list)

headers.description: Custom headers to send with the request (e.g. Authorization, X-API-Key). Each service can require different headers.

name.description: Name (slug): lowercase letters, numbers, hyphens. Unique per project.

mode.description: Mode of the MCP server: NORMAL (specific tools) or SMART (meta tools only)

selectedTools.description: Tool slugs to attach (NORMAL mode). Same as create.

isPublic.description: Whether the MCP server is public

config.description: Configuration for the MCP server (endpoint, authToken, etc.)

externalMcpConfigs.description: External MCP configs (name, url, headers?, tools) on workspace. Omit to leave unchanged.

params.description: Method params (e.g. cursor for tools/list; name + arguments for tools/call)

result.description: Result (e.g. tools/list → { tools, nextCursor }; tools/call → { content, isError })

isPublic.description: Whether this workflow (agent) is public for select in other projects

version.description: Version in form 1.0.x; incremented on each update

agentPrompt.description: System prompt / instructions for the agent

toolSlugs.description: Tool slugs to attach to the agent

isPublic.description: Whether this agent is public (visible in other projects’ agent select)

externalMcpConfigs.description: External MCP configs for workspace: [{ name, url, headers?, tools }]. tools = selected tool slugs from that MCP.

isPublic.description: Whether this workflow (agent) is public for select in other projects

version.description: Version in form 1.0.x; incremented on each update (for marketplace update check)

clonedFromWorkflowId.description: If cloned from marketplace: source workflow id

clonedFromVersion.description: Source workflow version at clone time (e.g. 1.0.1)

resumeValue.description: Resume value for human-in-the-loop (true/false or object)

connectedAccountId.description: ID of the connected account to use for the trigger

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return

input.description: Input data for the thread run

workflowId.description: Workflow ID (agent workflow) to use for this conversation

limit.description: Maximum number of history items to return
